content: blue sky yayalovestoknit revised may 1 2019 new language highlighted in red inserted in step 3 of the pattern to provide clarification this is the first crochet pattern i ve written although i ve crocheted for many years i m a knitter first and have only written knit patterns previously blue sky was written as the crochet companion to sunny day a knit pattern designed for the april hat-a-long for the hats for sailors group on ravelry each year hfs members and friends knit and crochet 100% superwash wool hats to be distributed to all personnel on selected navy or coast guard vessels in time for the winter holidays different vessels are selected each year it s our way of saying thank you to the wonderful men and women who so ably serve our country size adult the sample beanie style hat measures 8-⅟2 from top to bottom and 20 around the bottom edge these measurements were taken without any blocking or stretching the hat is stretchy enough to fit an adult size head yarn light worsted weight the sample hat was made using 54 grams/153 4 yards of fibranatura lima 100% superwash wool 100 grams/284 yards per ball in a medium aqua color hook 𝐈 other tool tapestry/darning needle gauge this is not a gauge measurement but will give you an idea of size 7 rounds in steps 11 thru 17 = 2-⅟2 vertical measurement 5 cluster stitches = 3 horizontal measurement 1 | pa ge abbreviations used bpsc back post single_crochet chain chain cluster cluster stitch double_crochet double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet sl slip_stitch st s stitch es helpful instructional videos how to crochet a cluster stitch https //www youtube com/watch v=wa7pn7jt1de how to crochet thru the back post https //www youtube com/watch v=rcbtd4mq5_k note the chain to begin each round does not count as a stitch work the 1st st of the round in the same stitch as the beginning chain when joining slip_stitch into the top of the 1st stitch not the beginning chain in this way you won t be adding a stitch and the ignored beginning chain will fill in the gap that can happen at the point of a join begin pattern 1 chain 2 half_double_crochet 12 times in the 2nd chain from the hook join with slip_stitch to work in the round 2 chain 2 2 double_crochet in each stitch around and join with slip_stitch 24 sts 3 chain 1 1 half_double_crochet in the first stitch 2 half_double_crochet in next st continue around and join with slip stitch 36 sts 4 chain 2 1 double_crochet in first 2 sts 2 double_crochet in next st continue around and join with slip_stitch 48 sts 5 chain 1 1 half_double_crochet in first 3 sts 2 half_double_crochet in next st continue around and join with slip_stitch 60 sts 6 chain 2 1 double_crochet in first 4 sts 2 double_crochet in next st continue around and join with slip_stitch 72 sts at this point the circle measures about 5-⅟2
